IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PERFORMANCE OF OPERA PRODUCTIONS, EDUCATION AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT PROGRAMS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE DALLAS OPERA IS A WORLD-CLASS PERFORMING ARTS ORGANIZATION PRODUCING OUTSTANDING MAINSTAGE AND CHAMBER OPERA REPERTOIRE, ATTRACTING NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL ATTENTION, COMMITTED TO EXTENSIVE COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION, AND MANAGED TO THE HIGHEST POSSIBLE STANDARDS OF ARTISTIC EXCELLENCE, ACCOUNTABILITY, EFFICIENCY AND FINANCIAL SUSTAINABILITY.
IRS990.Desc: MAINSTAGE AUDIENCE: 28,086 patrons attended 16 performances across 4 productions at Winspear Opera House: RIGOLETTO, HANSEL AND GRETEL, DAS RHEINGOLD, and COSI FAN TUTTE Another 5,327 participated in pre- and post-opera talks, open dress rehearsals, backstage tours, and other mainstage-related activities.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Digital programs: 22,355 viewed our digital programming, including and rebroadcasts of our 4 mainstage operas, education resources, and other performance-based content.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Community Engagement & Education programs: 9,393 North Texans enjoyed a range of community outreach programs, including 4,572 at 7 special concerts, 3,989 at 4 family performances of THE BILLY GOATS GRUFF and THE ELIXIR OF LOVE, and 832 at OperaTruck and other community-based performances. 16,640 students of all ages participated in our arts education programming, including 4 student matinee performances of THE BILLY GOATS GRUFF, Touring Opera performances in schools, Opera in a Suitcase workshops and performances in schools, dress rehearsals, and other workshops and education-oriented activities.

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: LOAN PAYABLE - THE DALLAS OPERA FDN

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ASC 740 FOOTNOTE: MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED THEIR INCOME TAX POSITIONS UNDER THE GUIDANCE INCLUDED IN ASC 740. BASED ON THEIR REVIEW, MANAGEMENT HAS NOT IDENTIFIED ANY MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS TO BE RECORDED OR DISCLOSED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
INTENDED USE OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS: THE INTENDED USE OF THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS IS FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE OPERA.

RECONCILIATION OF REVENUE PER AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS WITH RETURN: Bad Debt $21,044 Direct Fundraising Expenses (36,630) Cost of goods sold (3,995) Gain of sale of contributed stock 1,845 -------------- $(17,736)

RECONCILIATION OF EXPENSES PER AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS WITH RETURN: Bad Debt $(21,044) Direct Fundraising Expenses 36,630 Cost of goods sold 3,995 Gain of sale of contributed stock (1,845) --------------- $17,736

THE ORGANIZATION SHARES MANAGEMENT EMPLOYEES WITH THE DALLAS OPERA FOUNDATION. ALONG WITH THE BOARD AND TRUSTEES, MANAGEMENT ENSURES THE FINANCIAL SUPPORT PROVIDED BY THE FOUNDATION IS USED FOR THE PURPOSES AS DESCRIBED IN THE ENDOWMENT AGREEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DIRECTORS/TRUSTEES WITH FAMILY RELATIONSHIP: TDO HAS A MULTITUDE OF DIRECTORS/TRUSTEES WITH A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP. BELOW IS A LISTING FOR THE 22-23 FISCAL YEAR: - SPOUSES: MILENE AND TASSIO CARVALHO, MYRA AND ROBERT HULL, HOLLY AND TOM MAYER, PHYLLIS AND TOM MCCASLAND, ARLENE AND LOUIS NAVIAS, ENIKA AND RICHARD SCHULZE, STEVE AND BETTY SUELLENTROP, KERN AND MARNIE WILDENTHAL. - FAMILY RELATIONSHIP - SCOTT CHASE AND DEBRA WITTER, JEAN ANN AND SARA TITUS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TRUSTEES WHO MAY ELECT ONE OR MORE MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BODY: THE DIRECTORS ARE ELECTED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DECISIONS SUBJECT TO APPROVAL BY THE TRUSTEES: SOME DECISIONS MADE BY THE GOVERNING BODY REQUIRE FINAL APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PROCESS TO REVIEW FORM 990: THE 990 IS SENT TO THE ENTIRE BOARD FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PROCESS TO MONITOR COMPLIANCE WITH CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND SENIOR STAFF MEMBERS RECEIVE, REVIEW AND SIGN A STATEMENT THAT AFFIRMS THEIR COMPLIANCE WITH THIS POLICY. If a conflict of interest is found, the board or senior staff member recuses themselves from the respective committee or from any votes or decisions that are related.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A & 15B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION REVIEW: THE ORGANIZATION HAS ESTABLISHED AN INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION COMMITTEE COMPRISING OF FOUR OR MORE BOARD MEMBERS TO ASSIST WITH DETERMINATION OF COMPENSATION. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ESTABLISHING THE AMOUNT OF COMPENSATION FOR THE GENERAL DIRECTOR AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER ANNUALLY. THE COMMITTEE REVIEWS COMPARABLE NATIONAL AND LOCAL COMPENSATION DATA AND OTHER APPLICABLE RESOURCES AS RELEVANT AND READILY AVAILABLE, PRIOR TO DETERMINING, DOCUMENTING AND APPROVING COMPENSATION. Compensation for key employees is at the discretion of the General Director & CEO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AVAILABILITY OF DOCUMENTS: PRIOR TAX RETURNS and Financial Statements ARE available our website, Guidestar, IRS website, and upon request. GUIDESTAR GATHERS AND PUBLICIZES INFORMATION ABOUT NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. Governing Documents and Conflict of Interest policy are available on request.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 1a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AUTHORITY: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAS DESIGNATED MEMBERS OF AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE COMMITTEE SHALL HAVE AND EXERCISE THE AUTHORITY OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IN THE MANAGEMENT OF THE COMPANY WITH RESPECT TO MATTERS THAT ARISE BETWEEN MEETINGS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.
